title: Political Status and Standing
summary: Level 4 focuses on reclaiming your political status and lawful standing — understanding how identity, citizenship, and jurisdiction define your relationship to government. You will learn what it means to stand on the land and soil as a living man or woman, and how corporate fictions have replaced that status through registration and presumption.

questions.question: In the TSAA framework, what does 'political status' mean?
options: Your voting preference or party membership
Your legal classification and relationship to government
Your nationality based on birthplace
Your profession or social title

questions.question: Why is political status important under lawful self-governance?
options: Because it determines which taxes apply to you
Because it defines whether you are acting as a corporate person or a living being
Because it allows you to access international trade benefits
Because it changes your religious affiliation

questions.question: What happens when a birth is 'registered' with the state?
options: The child is recognized as a living heir to the land
A corporate entity or 'person' is created in commerce
The government provides lawful protection only
Nothing — registration has no legal effect

questions.question: According to TSAA, what is the effect of reclaiming your political status?
options: You become immune from all laws
You stand again as a living man or woman under the land jurisdiction
You lose all government privileges
You gain access to maritime commerce

questions.question: What lawful document records your return to the land and soil jurisdiction?
options: Marriage Certificate
Voter Registration
Deed of Re-Conveyance
Social Security Contract

questions.question: What does 'standing on the land' represent in lawful terms?
options: Owning property under a corporate title
Living peacefully under public law with natural rights intact
Operating as a registered franchise
Declaring yourself a citizen of a corporation

questions.question: Why is 'citizenship' considered a voluntary corporate status?
options: Because it identifies you as an employee or subject of a corporation
Because it is based purely on birthright
Because all people must have one to exist lawfully
Because it is automatically given by God

questions.question: In the lawful system, how is authority expressed?
options: By consent and contract between equals
Through mandatory government policy
By majority rule in elections
Through international treaties only

questions.question: What process allows a man or woman to correct misidentification in records?
options: Filing a Deed of Re-Conveyance and related status correction documents
Applying for a new driver’s license
Signing a government employment contract
Paying a registration renewal fee

questions.question: According to TSAA, lawful standing is proven by:
options: Being recognized by a foreign court
Having a valid passport
Publicly recording your political status on the land and soil
Declaring allegiance to the state
